abstract: The Environmental Protection Agency said it was taking the action because of BP’s “lack of business integrity,” which it said was demonstrated by the 2010 Deepwater Horizon blowout and oil spill.
snippet: The Environmental Protection Agency said it was taking the action because of BP’s “lack of business integrity,” which it said was demonstrated by the 2010 Deepwater Horizon blowout and oil spill.
lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The United States government has temporarily banned the British oil company BP from new federal contracts, citing the company’s “lack of business integrity.”

headline.main: BP Is Barred From Taking Government Contracts
headline.print_headline: BP Is Barred From Taking Government Contracts

byline.original: By John M. Broder and Stanley Reed
